channel.title: Hindustan Times - topnews
channel.description: News Headlines: Hindustan Times provides exclusive top stories of the day, today headlines from politics, business, technology, photos, videos, latest English news and much more
channel.copyright: Copyright (C) 2019 HT Media Limited. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: In Smriti Irani vs Rahul Gandhi over rape remark, Kanimozhi explains the 'conce...
item.description: In the Lok Sabha, Union Minister Smriti Irani who had defeated Gandhi in his pocket borough Amethi in this year’s national elections, led the charge. She demanded Rahul Gandhi’s apology for his comment and was joined by other lawmakers.

item.title: Coding booms among Chinese children
item.description: China has been making huge investments in robotics and Artificial Intelligence (AI), with the government issuing in 2017 an AI development plan which suggested programming courses be taught in both primary and secondary schools.

item.title: Chhapaak inspiration Laxmi Agarwal: 'Many asked if it was me after watching Deepika...
item.description: Laxmi Agarwal, the acid attack survivor Deepika Padukone is portraying in Meghna Gulzar’s upcoming film, is overwhelmed by the public response

item.title: 'Must apologise': Chaos in Parliament over Rahul Gandhi's 'rape in India' remark
item.description: Rahul Gandhi had launched a scathing attack on Narendra Modi over the rising crimes against women across the country as he raised the rape of a girl by Kuldeep Sengar, the Bharatiya Janata Party’s former legislator in Uttar Pradesh’s Unnao.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah to test back against Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma in Vizag
item.description: Team India will be hosting both Sri Lanka and Australia in January before heading to New Zealand for a full-fledged tour which consists of two Tests, three-ODIs and five T20I and that is where Ravi Shastri and team want Bumrah to be 100 per cent.

item.title: TMC's Mahua Moitra rushes to SC against citizenship law; she will have to wait
item.description: Mahua Moitra, the Trinamool Congress lawmaker had asked the Supreme Court to hear her petition against the Citizenship Act today or on Monday.

item.title: CAT 2019 answer key remains unchanged, check details here
item.description: IIM CAT Final Answer Key 2019:The answer key for common aptitude test (CAT) 2019 has remained unchanged after examining the objections raised against the questions. The IIMs had conducted the computer-based test in two sessions on 24 November, 2019.

item.title: 'I want to pursue my love for Sanskrit' says BHU's Muslim professor Firoz Khan
item.description: Firoz Khan said he wanted to pursue his love for Sanskrit and also promote the language. “I have a plan in mind but let me start my teaching duties first,” he said.Dr Feroz Khan, who had qualified for the post of Assistant Professor in different faculties in BHU, refused to speak on the controversy that made him opt for a change of faculty.

item.title: From CAB to SPG, how the Winter Session reinforces Amit Shah's leadership
item.description: While Amit Shah was a long-time minister in the Gujarat government, he entered Parliament via the Rajya Sabha only in the final lap of Modi’s first term in 2017. BJP leaders often acknowledge that there were only two gaps in the home minister’s political experience - of policymaking in the central government and of parliamentary practice.

item.title: Construction of 5 schools delayed due to fund crunch
item.description: The four upper primary schools are being upgraded under the ambitious Rastriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan.

item.title: BHU's professor Firoz Khan is in Sanskrit dept, will continue to teach Sanskrit:...
item.description: HRD minister Ramesh Pokhriyal ‘Nishank’ said “Firoz Khan is in the Sanskrit department, and will remain there.” He also said the assistant professor will continue to teach Sanskrit.

item.title: JNU students should call off strike to avail fresh concessions, 2-week relaxation:...
item.description: JNU Protest: Concession in hostel fees proposed by the HRD Ministry for JNU students and the two-week relaxation for the lost academic period can be availed if they call off their strike and normalcy is restored on campus, the ministry has advised.

item.title: Air quality improves in Delhi after heavy rains lash the national capital
Consumer commission directs BMW to replace Delhi customer's car damaged in acci...
item.description: Under the BMW Secure policy, a damaged vehicle is replaced with a new one upon confirmation of total loss of vehicle by a survey report.

item.title: CSBC Bihar Home Guard constable admit card 2019 to be released on December 15
item.description: Central Selection Board of Constable (CSBC) will release the admit card for Bihar Home Guard constable recruitment 2019 on December 15, 2019.
